result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy Arroyo Quinones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leroy Arroyo Quinones appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Pretrial Conference held.  Interpreter unavailable.  Defendant's friend Jenny V. interprets for the Defendant.  Defendant has not retained counsel as of this date.  Court adjourns matter.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Leroy Arroyo Quinones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/29/2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Leroy Arroyo Quinones not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.

Defendant Leroy Arroyo Quinones not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/8/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Leroy Arroyo Quinones not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@02:30pm
